Unsigned DIS Report Status : Unsigned ADMISSION DATE : 07-15-92 DISCHARGE DATE : 08-23-92 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Intracerebral hemorrhage . ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSIS : Status post resection of a cerebellar medulloblastoma . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient was a 50 year old , right handed , white male with a history of resection of left cerebellar medulloblastoma , resected six years ago and status post chemotherapy and radiation therapy , with a six month history of 30 pound weight loss , who was admitted to the Heaonboburg Linpack Grant Medical Center with a left basilar ganglion hemorrhage . At baseline , he had lived with his guardians , Pandeprob , he was " slow " , walked with a very ataxic gait , did not talk much and spends most of his time watching TV and smoking . He had had several months of increased difficulty swallowing and slurred speech . A recent head computerized tomography scan in 01/92 was negative . He had been evaluated by his local medical doctor for his weight loss . He was transferred to the Heaonboburg Linpack Grant Medical Center after being found in the bathroom , on the floor at 8 a.m. , unresponsive . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Cerebellar brain carcinoma , status post surgery , chemotherapy and radiation therapy six to seven years ago . He had not had any recurrence . He had history of alcohol abuse in the past . There was no cardiac disease , hypertension or diabetes mellitus . ALLERGIES : MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : None . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : A generally cachectic white male , resting quietly with his eyes closed . His blood pressure was 140/70 , heart rate 75 . The general medical examination was noted for bilateral temporal wasting . His oropharynx was clear . His skin was clear . The neck was supple without lymphadenopathy . The lungs were clear to percussion and auscultation . The heart exam revealed a normal Sl and S2 , regular rate and rhythm , no murmur , rub or gallop . The abdomen was soft , nontender , nondistended without hepatosplenomegaly . Extremities - no clubbing , cyanosis or edema . Pulses were 2+ throughout . The rectal tone was normal with no enlarged prostate , and he was heme positive . Neurologically , he opened his eyes with sternal rub , but not verbalization . He did not have verbal communication and he did not follow verbal commands . His pupils were asymmetric , 6 mm. to 4 mm. on the left , right pupil was 5 mm. reacting to 3 mm. The discs were flat . There was no retinopathy . He responded to threat on the left , but not on the right . He had a gag and good palpate movement . The tongue was midline . He had slight decreased corneal reflex on the right . He lifted his left leg off the bed , but no against resistance . His deep tendon reflexes were noted for symmetric reflexes with upper extremities being 2 and patella 3 . LABORATORY DATA : An erythrocyte sedimentation rate 3 , hematocrit 44 , white blood count 21.7 , lytes within normal limits . The head computerized tomography scan without contrast showed a 3 x 3 x 5 cm. hemorrhage extending form the left Sylvian fissure and put amen to the left front oparietal lobe . There was mass effect and some midline shift . There was blood in the bilateral posterior horns . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted to then Neurologic Intensive Care Unit . On admission , he was difficult to arouse and there was a large volume of heme aspirate per nasogastric tube . His blood pressure was not elevated . The aspirates soon became heme negative and he was started tube feds and replated for phosphate , magnesium , thiamine , folate and B12 . Once stabilized , he was transferred to the floor . An magnetic resonance imaging study on 07/17/92 showed a 5.3 x 4 x 4 cm. hematoma involving the basilar ganglion . There was no enhancement seen in the region of the original cerebellar medullo blastoma . Given his weight loss , past history of medullo blastoma , the patient underwent metastatic work up which included a computerized tomography scan of the chest which initially suggested a left hilar mass . This was followed up with a bronchoscopy and transbronchial biopsy was negative . A repeat computerized tomography scan of the chest I minus on 7/27/92 did not show the mass initially noted . A cerebral angiogram of the left coronary artery was performed and unremarkable except for mass effect from the hematoma . A testicular ultrasound was performed and was negative for mass . An esophagogastroduodenoscopy was performed and G-tube was performed at the same time . There was no specific gastritis and inflammation noted in the bulb and duodenum . An abdominal and pelvic computerized tomography scan was performed and revealed a 7 mm. hypodensity in the lateral left lobe of the liver which was non-enhancing . The urine cytology was negative for malignant cells . Initially , the patient remained drowsy until Decadron was added to his medical regimen . He awoke significantly after that with increased alertness , ability to interact with his environment and follow commands . He has slowly made progress with increased strength on the right side and ability to walk with assistance . He was started on Dexedrine because there was a question of whether some component of his lethargy could be depression . This seemed to help him remarkably with increased activity . His Decadron has been tapered slowly to zero and his examination on discharge was as follows : He needs persistent persuasion to increase his activity and was oriented to person , place , but not date . Speech was nonfluent with occasional single words . He sleeps with a hypophonia , but occasionally will speak louder when he is in better spirits . He followed all commands readily . His pupils were equal and reactive from 4 to 2 mm . There was some breakdown in saccads to smooth pursuit . He still had a significant right central facial droop . His gag was intact with palatal movements . On repetitive testing with Speech Therapy had not been able to swallow in a safe manner . Thus , he continued to be nothing by mouth and on tube feeds . He squints with his left eye when he tries to focus and claims this is because he sees double . He had approximately 4+ to 5/5 strength in the right upper and lower extremities . His left side was full . He had marked dysmetria bilaterally , but left greater than right to finger to nose and his gait was very ataxic . His deep tendon reflexes revealed slight hyper reflexia on the right with 3 right brachial radialis , triceps , biceps and patella . HE had an upgoing toe . On the left , his reflexes wee 2-2+ with a downgoing toe . He had right clonus , which was sustained . At that time , there was no evidence of a mass behind the hematoma . It was felt with his weight loss , that this needs to be relooked at in one month . Thus , he should return to the Heaonboburg Linpack Grant Medical Center to have a repeat head computerized tomography scan in one month to further evaluate a possible mass lesion behind the hematoma .
